alert.note: Alert for Snohomish (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 06 at 4:22AM PST until December 07 at 1:22AM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington... Snohomish River At Snohomish affecting Snohomish County. Snohomish River Near Monroe affecting Snohomish County. .The Snohomish river is cresting at Monroe early this morning. The flood crest will move downstream reaching Snohomish late this morning. The entire river will be receding this afternoon into tonight. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Snohomish River near Monroe. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, the Snohomish River will flood several roads and much of the low pasture land in the river valley. A stage of 16 feet at this location corresponds to Phase 2 in the Snohomish County Flood Warning System. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:00 AM PST Wednesday the stage was 16.3 feet. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The river is cresting early this morning at around 16.4 feet. - Forecast...The river will begin receding later this morning and fall below flood stage this afternoon. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this afternoon at 1230 PM PST.
